artefact.overview: How to take court action to repossess a property or evict a tenant if you're owed money for rent or a mortgage
artefact.more_information:
You will have to pay a £100 court fee, using a debit or credit card or Direct Debit.

%You can only use this service if you're owed money in rent or mortgage payments for a residential property.%
artefact.introduction:
You can take court action to repossess a property if you're owed money for rent or a mortgage, and the tenant or mortgage holder won't pay.

Apply using your Government Gateway ID. If you don't have one, register first using this service.
artefact.alternate_methods:
You can also apply by post.

You’ll need to fill in a [claim form](http://hmctsformfinder.direct.gov.uk/HMCTS/GetForm.do?court_forms_id=608 "claim form"){:rel="external"} and return it to your [local county court.](http://hmctscourtfinder.direct.gov.uk/HMCTS/ "local county court"){:rel="external"}

If you need help or advice, call or email the Possession Claim Online help desk:

$C
**Possession Claim Online help desk**  
<mcol@hmcts.gsi.gov.uk>  
0845 601 5935
$C


##Scotland

If you live in Scotland, you can use your local [sheriff court.](http://www.scotcourts.gov.uk/locations/index.asp "sheriff court"){:rel="external"}
expectations: Available in England and Wales only
